content: teapot cozy designed and written by zoe deterding find me on facebook and youtube as 24 carat crochet description this design is based on a chunky ribbed hat also available free in my ravelry store and has been adapted to allow for the spout and handle of a teapot this can be easily adapted to allow for a taller and/or wider teapot although i am from the uk i have used us crochet terminology this pattern will cover a teapot with the following dimensions details later for different sizes my teapot height = just under 6 inches my teapot circumference = 19 25 inches see picture on the right to see how i measured it skill level beginner supplies 6mm crochet hook any yarn with a suggested hook size of 5mm or 6mm will be fine see notes later about using cotton vs acrylic & other fiber types scissors yarn needle a pompom maker either a commercial gadget or traditional method with cardboard circles a measuring tape the main yarn used in my teapot cozy is loops & threads impeccable brights rainbow bright gauge suggested stitches for swatch alternating fpdc and half_double_crochet stitches 10 row in 4 inches 14 stitches in 4 inches diameter of first 4 rounds approx 4 5 inches cozy height 7 inches abbreviations chain = chain stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet your work will curl up towards you after a few rounds this is normal and will disappear later directions ch4 then slip_stitch into the first chain making a circle round 1 total of 13 stitches ch2 12 half_double_crochet into the ring slip_stitch into the top of the ch2 round 2 total of 26 stitches ch2 fpdc onto the ch2 from round 1 * half_double_crochet and fpdc onto the next stitch repeat from * 12 times slip_stitch at the top of the ch2 round 3 total of 39 stitches ch2 2 fpdc onto the next stitch * half_double_crochet 2 fpdc on the next stitch repeat from * 12 times slip_stitch at the top of the ch2 round 4 total of 52 stitches ch2 fpdc half_double_crochet fpdc on the same stitch as the half_double_crochet * half_double_crochet fpdc half_double_crochet fpdc on the same stitch as the last half_double_crochet repeat from * 12 times slip_stitch at the top of the ch2 round 5 total of 52 stitches ch2 fpdc half_double_crochet fpdc * half_double_crochet fpdc half_double_crochet fpdc repeat from * 12 times slip_stitch at the top of the ch2 round 6 total of 52 stitches repeat round 5 round 7 total of 27 stitches technically you are now working in row and not rounds back and forth down one side ch2 * fpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times round 8 total of 27 stitches ch2 turn your work * bpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last
